meanings.definition: operationalists: those who emphasize the importance of observable and measurable phenomena in scientific research
meanings.sent1: The operationalists conducted experiments to observe and measure natural events.
meanings.sent2: Many operationalists believe that only observable data should be used in their studies.
meanings.sent3: The operationalists were so focused on measuring everything that they even measured the time it took to make a cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: In the world of operationalists, everything is like a puzzle waiting to be solved with precise measurements.
meanings.sent5: The operationalists' dedication to observing and measuring made them stand out in the field of science.

meanings.definition: operationalists: adherents of a philosophical approach that focuses on practical procedures and techniques rather than abstract concepts
meanings.sent1: As operationalists, they preferred practical methods over theoretical discussions.
meanings.sent2: The operationalists valued hands-on experience more than abstract ideas.
meanings.sent3: The operationalists' philosophy was to 'do first, think later,' which sometimes led to interesting outcomes.
meanings.sent4: To the operationalists, philosophy was not just a subject of debate but a set of tools for everyday life.
meanings.sent5: Their operationalist mindset made them excel in applying techniques to solve real-world problems.
